qas.question: What is another informal name for Quaker?
What is the Quakers unifying belief?
What have the Quakers tried to avoid?
What collective movement are the Quakers associated with?
What types of Christianity do Quakers belong to?

answers.text: evangelical, holiness, liberal, and traditional conservative

context: Quakers, or <a0_0>Friends<a0_0/>, are members of a family of religious movements collectively known as <a3_0>the Religious Society of Friends<a3_0/>. The central unifying doctrine of these movements is <a1_0>the priesthood of all believers<a1_0/>. Many Friends view themselves as members of a Christian denomination. They include those with <a4_0>evangelical, holiness, liberal, and traditional conservative<a4_0/> Quaker understandings of Christianity. Unlike many other groups that emerged within Christianity, the Religious Society of Friends has actively tried to avoid <a2_0>creeds and hierarchical structures<a2_0/>.
